rus: Recent "genome-wide association studies" (GWAS) and their meta-analysis have identified numerous common genetic variants associated with coronary artery disease (CAD)/myocardial infarction (MI) risk. However, these variants can explain only a small proportion of the heritable risk for the disease ("missing heritability" issue). Meanwhile there is growing evidence that multi-loci interactions, including epistasis, may contribute to genetic explanation for CAD/MI risk but have not been unveiled yet. Compared to GWAS studies which test the associations of single common SNPs to the disease, multi-locus association analyses aim to test the effect of combinations for two or more SNPs. Accessing and mining the individual-level genotype data together with CAD-related phenotype information will help us to further investigate the genetic etiology of CAD. This dbGaP dataset will be analyzed independently and will be used only for research purposes. These data will not be used to determine the individual identity or family members within pedigree structures. In all cases, the datasets will be used to understand the genetics of CAD/MI.

ontologies.label: coronary artery disease
ontologies.definition: An artery disease that is characterized by plaque building up along the inner walls of the arteries of the heart resulting in a narrowing of the arteries and a reduced blood supply to the cardiac muscles.

ontologies.label: myocardial infarction
ontologies.definition: A coronary artery disease characterized by myocardial cell death (myocardial necrosis) due to prolonged ischaemia.

non_tech_rus: Coronary artery disease (CAD)/myocardial infarction (MI) is one of the leading causes of death worldwide. With the help of disease-related high-throughput genotype datasets we aim to investigate the impact of specific genetic variants of interest, and a combination of two or multiple genetic locus interactions (epistasis) on the disease risk, in order to improve our understanding of genetic etiology as well as the "missing heritability" issue in the context of CAD.
translatedUseRestriction: Samples will be used under the following conditions:\\u003cbr\\u003eData will be used for health/medical/biomedical research \\u003cbr\\u003eData will be used for methods development research [NMDS\\u003d0]\\u003cbr\\u003eData will be used to study:  lung cancer [DOID_1324(CC)], lung disease [DOID_850(CC)]\\u003cbr\\u003eData will not be used for commercial purpose\\u003cbr\\u003e
